author: Mrs Gabeva
text:
When you stay in VC long enough, it is inevitable to experience all of their irrational and illogical practices that they have in stock for you. Unfortunately. When you pass the point of being disappointed it is just funny. As i have said previously- expect the worst and VC will not disappoint. So for that reason they do not do so anymore. But it funny and yet another explicit example how completely ignorant the team behind the company is.
At the beginning of the summer I listed a pair of brand new Chanel jeans. Being actually slightly thick and from a winter collection (pre-fall 2016) , i decided to take them off as i had a pile of summer pre-loved items which were more logical to sell during summer. So i did so. Now being already fall season, i decided to list the item again as they are much more appropriate to be worn in the upcoming months so the chances of selling increase. Guess what - this time VC refused my listing because from the pictures they “could not verify the authenticity of the item”. Funny😂. First - i used the same pictures that i took in the summer and the same exact description, but now obviously their “expert “ team lost the little expertise that they have left in them and they decided to refuse the listing. 
What can i say more - the list of obscenties that VC has to offer is long and broad, and it is just to be expected to get worse, although their constant templates of  “reassurances “ that they are constantly “working on improving “. Guess what - if you are really working on something, you can actually eventually manage. The case with VC is just the opposite. So, guys, buckle up, the worst is yet to come when it comes to VC.
Ref. 18433667
title: Another illogical pratice

author: AF
text: Like everyone says, this company has the worst customer service on planet earth. I have had so many issues with them, which really seems that you are speaking to robots. On September 11, I sold Balenciaga belt, direct shipping, item 15817043, posted the item with DHL using the label provided. Two days later, I noticed that the shipping details were not updated on their website and emaild them to say that I had already sent the item, but it was shown as not dispatched yet. The operator said that all was fine. One month later, the item still shows as being on transit and of course that I was not paid. I contacted them and the operator said once again that it was still on transit. I insisted that it could not be possible, as it does not take 30 days to deliver the item. Since then, they ask me to send the proof of postage, which I sent, plus my ID to start the claim process. I did not buy myself the label, it was VC, and even if I had, I am not going to send copy of my ID by email to VC or DHL. This is an abbusive policy and illegal, because commercial companies cannot demand copy of passports or IDs from consumers. only governmental agencies or those who perform related services, such as airline companies can ask this, but the information needs to be encripted and they follow specific procedures and the operators that work in these departments have special certificates, by law. Finally, my role with VC obbliges me to disptach the item within a certain deadline, the delivery service is their responsibility.
title: Abbusive policy

text:

When problem show there is no one competent to understand problem, know whom contact and how solve the problem. As result seller is wasting his time writing notifications about problem on chat ( the only way to contact customer service , each time someone else is involved in the topic ), ask about data several times, but... they do not know how to solve it. They do not advice buyer about delay, but in case you want to write something " wrong" / advise buyer, they block your communication on platform and send warning that is it incorrect...in case it will repeat they will exclude you from platform :-)
This company is a joke , pretending to be international seller.

author: K S
text:
1. VC takes 30% commission, yet they give you a hermes shipping label. Not only you have to find your hermes pick-up service (40 min away from me!) and deliver it there, wasting time and money, hermes loses two out of three packages sent. I have a suspicion that they are in cahoots with hermes so that they can cheat both sellers and buyers out of their money. 
2. VC can't really be bother to sort it out, so I am left out of money and out of item, quite an expensive mistake. Instead, I get promises from the support service, that the item "will be delivered to me" (!!!!!). 
3. They demand a scan of your ID but refuse to confirm how they deal with this sensitive information. I suspect their staff might be stealing identities of their customers, especially as they just ignore my request of their GDPR policies. Something to report to authorities.
4. I keep receiving price offers, and as soon as I accept, the buyer disappears, but the information is sent out to all potential buyers. Moreover, VC immediately sends me an email suggesting I lower my price even more. I was offered to lower the price of my £150 item (already heavily discounted, as initially bought for 5 times the price) to £13 - so, gift it to them.
Advise? AVOID.

author: Elizabeth
text:
I bought a bag from VC on 22 Aug 2021. I thought a WHITE Sylvie bag and asked for an assessment because the bag is a beige color.  Of course when you buy an item there is often import taxes which where included in my overall cost, some $290.
VC advised me that in their opinion the bag was 'white'. I said ok please return the bag, Ill live with beige as I like the design.
Next thing I know they have put the bag up for sale on my account unbeknownst to me.  I sent number emails again to ask for its return - we are now into October and the bag was finally returned but with a catch I had to pay $290 again to have the bag released by Oz customs!  See below one of the many conversation I have had with VC, there comments are in  "   ".
You are still very much confused about the situation and this is becoming quite frustrating – 

“We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience as your item was being relisted under your account after the second check”. What second check, I asked for one assessment only?  Not a second check, this was the first check.

"Please note that we relisted it for sale in your account according to our return policy and to avoid the VAT. Import costs are not VC responsibility as she returned it when it was compliant."  I didn’t return the bag.  I just wanted it checked and sent many emails to asked for the bag to be returned to me, this was ignored by VC and they listed it for sale.

I did the honest thing and paid the import tax when I first purchased the bag and believed your customer service operators when they said pay the tax AGAIN on its arrival to Oz and VC will refund the tax of $290, so that I wast double paying the tax.

I took screen shots of most of the conversions as I now don't trust this company.
Waiting on the final outcome of this situation, not fair, unethical, just do the right thing and refund $290.
title: Double payment for import taxes

author: Emily Berlangieri
text:
Worst buyer experience I feel completely ripped off, I wouldn't recommend shopping on Vestiaire. I purchased a pair of Prada nylon shorts, before purchasing them I asked the seller to provide measurements of the waist to ensure they would fit, well the seller sent me measurements that were hugely inaccurate. I sent them back to Vestiaire expecting a full refund as I was told by "Vanessa for Vestiaire Collective" via email that if they didn't match the seller description that "we will process your refund" exactly what I was told via her email. When they arrived back to Vestiaire I received an email saying that they matched the description, total bs I even included printed screenshots of my conversation with the seller about the size of the shorts with my return to Vestiaire. 

Now they have uploaded the shorts onto my profile without my prior knowledge and its my responsibility to sell them at a huge loss of authentication fees, shipping and customs fees I had to pay and I can't even adjust the price to include my losses on my own profile!!! An absolute joke, Vestiaire is a money making scam benefiting Vestiaire to the detriment of customers.
title: Worst buyer experience
